Answer one question. Each question is worth [25 marks].

1.    (a)   Explain how taxes and subsidies differ in their effect on the market price and
            quantity of a good.                                                                [10 marks]

      (b)   “It is essential that a government supports its farmers by subsidizing
            agricultural output.” Evaluate this view.                                          [15 marks]


2.    (a)   Using appropriate diagrams, explain the difference between demand-side
            and supply-side economic policies.                                                 [10 marks]

      (b)   Evaluate the use of supply-side policies to improve the performance of
            an economy.                                                                        [15 marks]


3.    (a)   Explain two factors which may cause an appreciation of a country’s
            exchange rate.                                                                     [10 marks]

      (b)   Evaluate the extent to which an appreciating exchange rate may benefit or harm
            an economy.                                                                        [15 marks]


4.    (a)   Explain why economic growth rates may differ between developing countries.         [10 marks]

      (b)   Evaluate the role of foreign direct investment in assisting a developing country
            to achieve greater growth and development.                                         [15 marks]
